title: Trump backs reappointment of ‘very talented’ Italian PM
text:
U.S. President Donald Trump | Alex Wong/Getty Images Trump backs reappointment of ‘very talented’ Italian PM US president tweets his support to Giuseppe Conte.

ROME — It's perhaps not the endorsement he's been waiting for, but Italy's outgoing prime minister has won the backing of Donald Trump as he waits on news of his possible reappointment.

As Italian parties scramble to find a way out of the political crisis triggered by Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte's resignation, with the populist 5Star Movement and the center-left Democratic Party (PD) trying to form a new coalition, the U.S. president decided to chime in.

"Starting to look good for the highly respected Prime Minister of the Italian Republic, Giuseppe Conte. Represented Italy powerfully at the G-7. Loves his Country greatly & works well with the USA. A very talented man who will hopefully remain Prime Minister!" Trump tweeted on Tuesday afternoon.

The Conte-led government, comprising the 5Stars and the far-right League of Interior Minister Matteo Salvini, collapsed earlier this month. Salvini pulled the plug on the coalition, hoping for a snap election that could make him prime minister, given the League's lead in the polls.

Salvini's dream scenario could still materialize but looks increasingly unlikely. An initial PD veto on Conte's reappointment has officially fallen, which could pave the way for a new 5Stars-PD government that excludes the League from power.

The two parties are currently engaged in negotiations ahead of their respective meetings with President Sergio Mattarella on Wednesday afternoon.

Trump's endorsement of Conte — whom he initially called "Giuseppi" before deleting and rewriting his tweet — isn't entirely surprising. The two leaders have heaped praise on each other in the past.
description: US president tweets his support to Giuseppe Conte.
